ForecastArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the forecast to query.

StartDate.Description: The start date for the forecast. Specify the date using this format: yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss (ISO 8601 format). For example, 2015-01-01T08:00:00.

EndDate.Description: The end date for the forecast. Specify the date using this format: yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss (ISO 8601 format). For example, 2015-01-01T20:00:00.

Filters.Description:
The filtering criteria to apply when retrieving the forecast. For example, to get the forecast for client_21 in the electricity usage dataset, specify the following:
To get the full forecast, use the CreateForecastExportJob operation.

NextToken.Description: If the result of the previous request was truncated, the response includes a NextToken . To retrieve the next set of results, use the token in the next request. Tokens expire after 24 hours.

WhatIfForecastArn.Description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the what-if forecast to query.

StartDate.Description: The start date for the what-if forecast. Specify the date using this format: yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss (ISO 8601 format). For example, 2015-01-01T08:00:00.

EndDate.Description: The end date for the what-if forecast. Specify the date using this format: yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss (ISO 8601 format). For example, 2015-01-01T20:00:00.

Filters.Description:
The filtering criteria to apply when retrieving the forecast. For example, to get the forecast for client_21 in the electricity usage dataset, specify the following:
To get the full what-if forecast, use the CreateForecastExportJob operation.

NextToken.Description: If the result of the previous request was truncated, the response includes a NextToken . To retrieve the next set of results, use the token in the next request. Tokens expire after 24 hours.
